title: Product-Based Brand + Product Marketing Masterplan (DTC/Ecommerce, Consumer Apps, Retail/Omni)
intro: Plan2 covers product marketing end-to-end: planning, execution (including ASO & CRO), and reporting. Use this as a living blueprint and adapt per category.

stages.title: STAGE 1 — PLANNING
stages.description: Align product, market, and marketing strategy before any campaign spend. Product marketing merges with marketing ops here.

steps.title: 1. Audience & Market Research
steps.goal: Understand who to target, the jobs they need done, where they spend time, and willingness to pay.
how: Internal Data Review: GA4 (demographics, tech usage, behavior flow), CRM/Ecommerce (AOV, repeat rate, LTV), App analytics (activation, retention, churn), Social analytics (Meta/TikTok/YouTube).
Qualitative Discovery: JTBD interviews covering triggers, prior solutions, decision criteria, anxieties; review mining (Amazon, Walmart, Trustpilot, App Store, Google Play).
Quantitative Validation: Surveys (n ≥ 200) for usage patterns, value drivers, price sensitivity (Van Westendorp, Gabor-Granger), feature preference (MaxDiff).
Segmentation: Behavioral (RFM), need-based (jobs/pains), media-based (channels used).
Persona Building: name/photo, triggers, goals, objections, platforms, example ad hooks.

steps.title: 2. Competitive & Channel Gap Analysis
steps.goal: Find whitespace opportunities and channel strengths/weaknesses.
how: Identify direct & indirect competitors.
SEO Gap: SEMrush/Ahrefs keyword & content gaps.
Backlink Gap: Ahrefs Link Intersect.
Creative Gap: Meta/TikTok/Pinterest Ad Libraries.
PPC Gap: SpyFu, Adbeat, Shopping feed analysis.
Affiliate Gap: network presence, partner volume.
Offer Gap: pricing, bundles, warranties.
Channel Scoring: rate fit, cost, speed, complexity.

steps.title: 3. Product Gap Analysis & Framework Selection
steps.goal: Identify where the product underperforms or misses opportunity and select prioritization frameworks.
how: Customer Needs vs Product using Kano Model: must-have, performance, delighters.
Competitor Feature Matrix: parity, advantage, disadvantage.
Opportunity Scoring: Impact/Effort matrix.
Framework Choice: Kano, MoSCoW, RICE, Opportunity Solution Tree.
Roadmap Prioritization: target high impact/low effort for early release.

steps.title: 4. Positioning, Messaging & Proof
how: Use April Dunford Positioning Canvas: category, target segment, primary benefit, proof points.
Build a Messaging House: top-level promise → 3–5 benefits → feature-to-proof mapping.
Create persona-tailored variants.

steps.title: 5. Offer, Packaging & Pricing
how: Define tiering, bundles, subscriptions, guarantees.
Set promo cadence & MAP policy.
For App/SaaS: decide trial vs freemium and upgrade triggers.

steps.title: 6. Brand System & Creative Assets
how: Codify tone of voice, typography, logo variations, color palette.
Create ad templates for all formats.
Set PDP & landing page design standards.

steps.title: 7. Funnel & Channel Strategy
how: Map funnel: Awareness → Consideration → Conversion → Retention.
Assign channels to stages & personas.
Budget split: 70% proven, 20% emerging, 10% experimental.

steps.title: 8. Tracking, Attribution & Product Analytics
how: Define event schema: marketing + product usage.
Implement GTM + server-side tagging; add SDKs for apps.
Choose attribution model: MMM and MMP for apps.
PLG: implement in-app onboarding flows and milestone comms.

steps.title: 9. Budgeting, Forecasting & Inventory
how: Combine top-down % revenue budget with bottom-up CAC/ROAS model.
Link marketing pushes to inventory availability.

stages.title: STAGE 2 — EXECUTION
stages.description: Strategy meets action: Launch, Channel Playbooks, Product Marketing Activities, ASO, and CRO.

steps.title: 1. Product Launch & GTM
how: Pre-Launch: finalize product/packaging/assets; sales/CS enablement (battlecards, objection handling, demo scripts); teasers via social, email waitlists, PR embargoes.
Launch Week: hero content (launch video, press release), influencer seeding; paid push on top 2–3 channels; collect UGC and incentivize reviews.
Post-Launch: proof wave (testimonials, case studies); retargeting campaigns.

steps.title: 2. Channel Execution SOPs — SEO
how: Technical: audit with Screaming Frog; fix Core Web Vitals; implement schema markup.
Content: keyword research, PDP/PLP copy, blogs, comparisons, FAQs.
Authority: digital PR, link-building, HARO/Connectively outreach.
Cadence: monthly technical audits; weekly content publishing.

steps.title: 3. Channel Execution SOPs — Paid Search & Shopping
how: Structure: brand, non-brand, competitor, Shopping, Performance Max.
Feed Optimization: titles, GTIN, attributes, review feed quality.
Bidding: use CPA/ROAS-based strategies.
Cadence: weekly query review; monthly creative refresh.

steps.title: 4. Channel Execution SOPs — Paid Social & Influencers
how: Audience Mix: broad, lookalikes, interests, retargeting stacks.
Creative: UGC, demos, social proof, offer-driven ads.
Testing: 3–5 net new ads per week with structured kill thresholds.

steps.title: 5. Channel Execution SOPs — Email, SMS, Push
how: Flows: welcome, abandon (browse/cart), post-purchase, win-back.
Campaigns: promo calendar and seasonal pushes aligned to inventory.
App Push: onboarding, milestone, reactivation journeys.

steps.title: 6. Channel Execution SOPs — Affiliate & Partnerships
how: Select networks (Awin, CJ, Impact) aligned to niche and geo.
Recruit via outbound and inbound sign-ups; seed products and assets.
Manage with monthly partner performance reviews and pruning.

steps.title: 7. ASO (App Store Optimization)
how: Keyword research with AppTweak/Sensor Tower.
Optimize metadata: keyword-rich title, subtitle, description.
Creative: icon, screenshots, preview video; test variants.
Ratings & Reviews: prompt in-app after positive moments.
A/B Testing: Google Play experiments, iOS PPO.
Apple Search Ads: brand defense and competitor conquest.

steps.title: 8. CRO (Conversion Rate Optimization)
how: Research: analytics, heatmaps, voice of customer.
Prioritize with PIE/ICE scoring.
Test Types: Web (headlines, CTAs, offer framing, checkout simplification); App (onboarding sequence, feature placement, upsell timing).
Analyze uplift and impact on LTV; maintain a test log.

steps.title: 9. Product Marketing Ongoing Activities
how: Adoption Campaigns: onboarding emails and in-app tooltips.
Feature Launches: run mini-GTM for each update.
Retention Programs: loyalty and VIP access.
Upsell/Cross-Sell: target based on purchase history.

steps.title: 1. KPI Tree
kpis: Business: revenue, gross margin, MER, CAC, LTV.
Product: activation rate, feature adoption, churn.
CRO: CVR by step, RPV, AOV, test win rate.
ASO: keyword rank, store CTR, listing CVR.

steps.title: 2. Dashboard Architecture (Power BI / GDS)
how: Sources: GA4, GSC, Ads, CRM, Email/SMS, Mixpanel, MMP, affiliate, marketplaces.
Structure: Exec Overview (KPIs, trends), Channel Deep Dives, Product Adoption, CRO Impact, ASO Performance.

steps.title: 3. Cadence
how: Daily: spend pacing and anomaly checks.
Weekly: channel reports and CRO updates.
Monthly: budget reallocation and roadmap updates.
Quarterly: strategic review and MMM updates.
